ygData.subject: Re: summary:
ygData.msgSnippet: Good summary I would also like to add my opinon on what to look for in items, AC is the most important thing in the game. the higher it is the less you get
ygData.messageBody:
Good summary I would also like to add my opinon on what to look for in
items,

AC is the most important thing in the game. the higher it is the less you
get hit.
HP the higher this is the more you can get hit and with higher AC you can
survive longer
STR helps do more damage during a fight. a few extra hp's of damage add up
over the course of a longer fight. fully buffed i do fist damage in the 60's
and have done a 113 FK
AGI affects AC very little but does help us avoid hits also


----- Original Message -----
From: <imari_dellimore@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, January 10, 2000 1:01 PM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] summary:


> From: imari_dellimore@...
>
> I thought I would provide a litttle summary on all the stats that are
important
> to monks and why they are important:
>
> In order of importance:
>
> 1) STR thisaffects damage on both fists and Flying Kick
>
> 2) AGI this affects our ac and Mitigates (reduces) damage when we are hit
>
> 3) STA this allows us to keep fighting without getting fatigued
(important at
> high levels when fights last long and DW/DA go off more often) and adds
> hitpoints.
>
> 4) Int/Wisdom these reduce our suceptability to CHARMING and Messmerizing
> spells that some high level critters cast, and increase our learning rate.
Good
> to have for trade skills.
>
> 5) CHA prices you get at vendor.
>
> NOTE: DEX this is UNIMPORTANT and does nothing except increase our
LEARNING rate
> of the melee skills.
>
